intro: Ceodes gracilescens, commonly known as the slender ceodes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
